title: Judgment Day by Assembly
outcome: Assemblies convene a public tribunal, putting remaining Council and Directorate members on trial. Witnesses expose years of BCI manipulation. Citizens decide the fate of former officials and the system through open referendum on governance.

events.description: Neighborhood assemblies announce a public tribunal for surviving Council and Directorate members, streamed citywide.
Rada and affected residents testify, revealing how Halden’s last BCI changes rewrote the boundaries of citizenship.
Oksana defends her emergency patch but admits the BCI was fatally flawed. Officials face citizen questioning. Streets fill as the city watches the trial.
Citizens vote: convicted officials are stripped of privileges. The city agrees to repurpose former BCI infrastructure for participatory decision-making.
A final referendum is held—residents choose free assemblies and open governance over algorithmic control, closing the BCI era.
